data.title: Selecting call stack entries does not move editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

---

I have been having some intermittent issues with the call stack not moving. More precisely, it moves and then instantly moves back to the location of a thrown exception. Here's an example:

![vscode-callstack-bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1007463/27327412-5eec6ee0-5563-11e7-8c87-ecfd015ad8c9.gif)

I have been randomly throwing in new exceptions in my code, and the call stack does work properly sometimes, so I really don't know what is going on.

Notes:
- Same results when setting the protocol to "inspector".
- If I manually scroll to the proper location, the green line marker is there.
- There are no errors in the developer console.

data.title: Use List instead of Tree for the QuickPick

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Since QuickPick is a flat list It does not make sense to use the `Tree` as the implenetation mechanism we should use the `List` instead. 
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27900

data.title: Minimap dissapears when using references popup supplied by referencesCodeLens.enabled = true
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.3|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.3.3|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enable codelens in Preferences -> Settings:  "typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled": true
2. The reference count will appear above methods and classes, click the gray x references link above the method/class, to see where it is referenced from.
3. Click above the popup that shows the references.
4. The minimap on the right will now be made into a normal vertical scrollbar.

A reboot of VSCode will show the minimap again instead of the vertical scrollbar, but only until the references popup is used again.

|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|indent-rainbow|oderwat|0.6.1|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.9|
|you-complete-me|RichardHe|1.0.36|
|snake-trail|richie5um2|0.6.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.9.0|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.8.1|
|trailing-spaces|shardulm94|0.2.11|
|vscode-fileutils|sleistner|2.6.2|
|vscode-open-project|svetlozarangelov|0.0.9|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|clang-format|xaver|1.5.0|
|highlight-trailing-white-spaces|ybaumes|0.0.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Place cursor in the middle of a line somewhere. 
2. Hold Shift. Step up a few lines with arrow keys.
3. Press End.
4. Selection is now from the original cursor position to the end of the original line.

Expected result: Selection should be from the original cursor position to the end of the line I was in when I pressed End. Same bug exists for Home and selecting down. 

Giffed:
![vscode_shiftselect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1578924/27324815-ab145f92-55a6-11e7-9bc5-c89c493e1461.gif)
(sorry about visual glitch from gif tool)

data.title: Shortcut key for editor.action.transformToUppercase not working on Ubuntu 17.04
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (c23a87bb68403438324c179622dfcff92e098bc9, 2017-06-20T05:10:58.530Z)
- OS Version: Plasma Desktop / Ubuntu 17.04 / Linux x64 4.10.0-22-generic
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
graphql-for-vscode|kum|1.4.1

Note sure Extensions is relevant, though.

---

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open `Keyboard Shortcuts` from Settings
2. Click "For advanced customizations open and edit keybindings.json"
3. Add the following to the *User* keybindings.json

```json
	{
		"key": "ctrl+shift+u",
		"command": "editor.action.transformToUppercase",
		"when": "editorTextFocus"
	}
```
4. Save & Close
5. Open a text file in the editor.
6. Select some text and press <kbd>Ctrl</kbd>+<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>U</kbd> on the keyboard.

### Expected Behaviour
The selected text is transformed to all uppercase and the selection remains selected.

### Actual Behaviour
Nothing happens and unable to input any text or keyboard navigate in the editor. Pressing <kbd>Esc</kbd> gets the editor unstuck.

### Note
If you need me to debug this somehow, willing to help, just give me instructions.

data.title: [themes] Add `editor.findMatchForeground`

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When using Find & Replace, I like to highlight the current search match differently. This is particularly helpful when refactoring and proof-reading, especially if there are many matches.

I can add a colour customisation for `editor.findMatchBackground` to achieve this. However, as the foreground colour is not editable, I have a contrast issue with the default foreground colour in the theme.

In my case, I'd prefer to set the background colour to something light, like `#b2b231` and change the foreground colour of the match to `#000000`.

Obviously not a pressing issue; a nice to have 👍

data.title: VSCode does not exit delve properly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|aurelia|AureliaEffect|0.3.4|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0|
|task-master|ianhoney|0.1.39|
|quicktask|lkytal|2.8.0|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.62|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.4|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a Golang project
2. Debug something
3. Stop debugging (via `Stop`, aka the red square or Shift+F5)

---

`delve` is the debugger for golang, or at least it's the one that the Go extension uses. When you debug something with delve, it creates a large binary file in the current directory. If you debug a main function (`dlv debug`), you get 'debug'. If you debug a test function (`dlv test`), you get 'debug.test'.

In normal `delve` usage, when you're done, you `quit` delve. Delve then deletes this file. Apparently VSCode gracelessly terminates (SIGKILL?) delve, which means the file sticks around.

data.title: workspaceStats: support multi root
data.body:
We use `workspaceStats.ts` to collect telemetry about the workspace. With the introduction of multi root this code should be revisited. Instead of` contextService.getWorkspace()`, please use `contextService.getWorkspace2()` which will give you access to the roots property. 

We will soon have a new method on `IFileService` to resolve an array of roots (`resolveFiles`) which can be used for this case.

I also suggest to log the fact that multi root is being used so that we can distinguish single from multi root easily.

data.title: Inconsistencies between find widget and find viewlet
data.body:
If you have no search term in the find in current file widget and the find viewlet why do the replace commands behave differently?

ctrl+h will open the find widget and focus the **find** textbox

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/27319190-18f417bc-5545-11e7-82dd-c96609eade35.png)

ctrl+shift+h will open the find viewlet and focus the **replace** textbox

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/27319204-27aed3aa-5545-11e7-90e5-18b945cd9994.png)

Also the different wording of Find/Search seems easy to fix.

data.title: Allow links in hover decorations to be inside a <code> tag
data.body:
Related to #29076 

Allows link actions when links are embedded inside another tag -- e.g. `<code>` tags

For example in GitLens I want to add the following command links:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/641685/27618753-1e0076d6-5b8c-11e7-9124-d0d379314a41.png)

And I'd like to keep the `<code>` tag styling on them.

@mjbvz @jrieken I've repurposed this PR to just allow the above.

data.title: [1.13.0 REGRESSION] Don't open every triggerFile for ConfigFileDiagnostic events
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0

In 1.12.0 this event only caused the project to reload from the config.  In a refactor in 1.13.0, it opens every `event.body.triggerFile` in  `findLanguage` before reloading the project.

The triggerFile for this event doesn't always belong to the project. See issue https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/16635

The regression was introduced by https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/0d5c9f418b2c68dd87bffb8c481ebbb0022e9a41

Before this change, findLanguage was just checking the extension, so the only thing these spurious triggers did was reload the project.  Now, since it opens a file that doesn't belong to the project, which causes `tsserver` to create a new implicit project.  It also causes the `tsserver` to send diagnostics for the file since it thinks it is open in the editor which it is not.

data.title: Layer breakers from tasks experiments
data.body:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/28909 introduced quite a bit of layer breakers into the workbench. 

`src/vs/workbench/parts/quickopen/common/quickopenActions.ts` is very task specific and as such it should move into `src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks`

The changes to `textFileEditorModel` are not fitting. `showTaskNotification` seems very task specific and should not go into the file world that has no knowledge around tasks. There are events (e.g. on the editor service) that can be used to listen to files opening so that this can all happen from the outside.

In addition, please stay away from using `contextService.getWorkspace() `and use `getWorkspace2()` instead which is capable of multi root information.

Thanks!

data.title: Layer breaker in: vs/workbench/electron-browser/shell.ts
data.body:
There is a dependency to `ITextMateService` and `MainProcessTextMateSyntax` from `vs/workbench/parts/codeEditor/...`. 

`vs/workbench/parts` is like a `contrib` folder. It should be possible to bundle the workbench without any of those parts.

I suggest to move that service into the `vs/workbench/services` (= core services) scope thereby.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Code-Organization#workbench-parts

data.title: Layer breaker in: vs/workbench/browser/parts/editor/editorStatus.ts
data.body:
There is a dependency to `IPreferencesService` from `vs/workbench/parts/preferences/common/preferences`. 

`vs/workbench/parts` is like a `contrib` folder. It should be possible to bundle the workbench without any of those parts.

I suggest to move that service into the `vs/workbench/services` (= core services) scope thereby.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Code-Organization#workbench-parts

data.title: Layer breaker in: vs/workbench/services/themes/electron-browser/themeCompatibility.ts
data.body:
There is a dependency to `ansiColorIdentifiers` from `vs/workbench/parts/terminal/electron-browser/terminalColorRegistry`

`vs/workbench/parts` is like a `contrib` folder. It should be possible to bundle the workbench without any of those parts.

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Code-Organization#workbench-parts

data.title: Allow `command:` links in hover decorations
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (77bf512f0eba6c7082f5b442ac5de585febcab23, 2017-06-19T08:59:44.265Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16215
---

It would be great to be able to execute commands from hover decorations. It would provide for powerful navigation options as well as open up many other uses.

For example, in GitLens I would love to have the shas `eb411003` & `078960e8` be links that would open the commit details command. And the `Changes` be a link to open the diff with previous command.

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eamodio/vscode-gitlens/master/images/screenshot-line-blame-annotations.png)

data.title: Code Insiders does not start without options
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install code insiders (1.14.0)
2. Launch from start menu
3. VSCode does not start

By running from console, I can get following message:
```
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>"Code - Insiders.exe"

C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>
TypeError: Cannot read property 'reopenFolders' of undefined
    at e.getRestoreWindowsSetting (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:270796)
    at e.doGetWindowsFromLastSession (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:269767)
    at e.getWindowsToOpen (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:269099)
    at e.open (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:265701)
    at t.openFirstWindow (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:316903)
    at C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:314524
    at t.invokeFunction (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:164273)
    at t.startup (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:314488)
    at C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:321107
    at Object.v [as _notify] (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:67486)
```

If any file/folder path or `-n` is given, vscode starts normally:
```
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>"Code - Insiders.exe" .

C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>
>>> This works
```

```
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>"Code - Insiders.exe" -n

C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>
>>> This also works
```

Using a new profile by `--user-data-dir` does not help:
```
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>"Code - Insiders.exe" --user-data-dir D:\new_profile_directory

C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders>
TypeError: Cannot read property 'reopenFolders' of undefined
    at e.getRestoreWindowsSetting (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:270796)
    at e.doGetWindowsFromLastSession (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:269767)
    at e.getWindowsToOpen (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:269099)
    at e.open (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:265701)
    at t.openFirstWindow (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:316903)
    at C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:314524
    at t.invokeFunction (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:164273)
    at t.startup (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:314488)
    at C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:321107
    at Object.v [as _notify] (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\code\electron-main\main.js:4:67486)
```

data.title: [Tree View Explorer] Running the contributed command:'****' failed.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.docker-explorer 
2. In context menu of the Docker Container list, click any command for several times.
    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1050213/27312413-b6089852-559a-11e7-8734-31965286ad68.png)
3. Then you will see below error randomly 
    ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1050213/27312449-f29d23be-559a-11e7-826a-e2f79e2c415a.png)

In this extension, the tree view will be auto-refreshed every 1 second. If I disable the auto-refresh, this error will never happen. So I guess the error happens when the tree view is re-rendering.
